vision.notes: Present in most species, though possibly reduced in some specialized species. Data is limited, but presumed functional.

mechanoreception.notes: Likely present due to being fish. Given the presence of bony plates, lateral line may be specialized but is presumed functional. The catfish family possesses neuromasts sensitive to water movement.

chemoreception.notes: Common in fish. Likely important for food detection and possibly social communication.

electroreception.notes: Electroreception is common in Siluriformes, but context doesn't specify if Loricariidae possess this trait. Thus, it is currently unknown.
